current_task.title: Update reverse proxy for LiveKit routing
current_task.description:
Update the Caddy reverse proxy configuration to route LiveKit WebSocket traffic to the LiveKit server. This enables clients to connect to LiveKit through the main entry point.

**Implementation steps:**
1. Add LiveKit WebSocket route in Caddyfile (before the catch-all handle /* block):
   - Route `/livekit/*` to `livekit:7880` (LiveKit's WebSocket port)
   - Preserve WebSocket upgrade headers (Connection, Upgrade)
   - Enable WebSocket for SFU signaling

2. The /api/livekit/token endpoint is already routed via the catch-all to hush:3001, no changes needed there.

**Note:** LiveKit's RTC ports (7881 and UDP 50000-60000) are exposed directly in docker-compose and don't need reverse proxy routing - only the initial WebSocket connection goes through Caddy.
acceptance_criteria: handle /livekit/* block added to Caddyfile before handle /*
LiveKit handle block proxies to livekit:7880
WebSocket headers preserved (header_up Connection, header_up Upgrade)
Caddy config syntax is valid (test with caddy fmt or caddy validate)
Existing Matrix and Hush routes unchanged
